The staff were more than helpful only fault is the breakfast in the restaurant was not to good there are better places to eat but overall would stay there again..

reviews.title: Married at the Flamingo -- Spectacular!!!
reviews.text: We stayed at the Flamingo Oct 14-20th and were married there on the 16th. We checked in at the airport which was pretty quick and easy, and I recommend, because we often saw long lines at check in at the hotel. The ONLY bad experience we had was when we first got there, we were told where the elevators were, took them up, and figured..."Hey we're almost there!". Wrong. We ended up walking down about 10 verrrry long corriders while hauling about 150 pounds in luggage (yes Continental weighed it and charged us for it) after a verrrry long flight and long rental car experience. SO, make sure you find the correct elevator bank, because we sure didn't. It will be a life saver. After that now laughable experience, everything was absolutely perfect. We had a mini-suite on the top floor that was huge, clean, and had a magnificent view of the pool/garden area. Floor to ceiling windows, couch, 4 chairs, good size bathroom, and LOTS of open space. Didn't have a fridge but we rented one for $10 a day, and they brough it up within 20 minutes of me calling for it. Had a welcome note from the wedding staff awaiting us and with further wedding day instructions. Wedding staff were extremely friendly and accomodating. Wedding cermony was absolutely perfect...we were married in the indoor chapel, very private and intimate as we hoped. Photos were waaay beyond our expectations (although we did shell out some good money to get all those great photos). We had our reception dinner at Ventuno...excellent!! Great food, better service. We were a little hesitant at first after dealing with them via phone/email, they seemed a little unorganized and unreliable, but boy did they come through in the clutch and provide great service (cake was one of the best i've ever had). Room service was great (try the Juevos Rancheros for breakfast). Champagne bruch at Paradise Garden Buffet was really good...food was decent, but the view and ambience were great. Pool was as good as expected. Try the jacuzzi's that are kind of isolated behind main pool, they were so relaxing. Gambling was good, plenty of cocktail waitresses to bring strong drinks, even when you're playing pennies and nickels. Margaritaville was as good as expected (try the flavored shots). We would recommend any young couples stay here (we're in our late 20's), even more if you're looking for a great wedding destination. We would do it all over again in a heartbeat. Plus, like everybody else says, you damn sure can't beat the location, location, location.

reviews.title: Dump>>>> Beware do not stay here>>
reviews.text: This has to be the worst hotel I have ever stayed in.. the rooms have had no updating in 10 years, even the bedding is terrible. The furniture was banged up, the beds were uncomfortable and the bathroom was one step up from you find in 3rd world country. Also, the air in the hotel, even on a non-smoking room is so bad, I had a sore throat from the poor ventilation. My view was the roof of the lower building with garbage sitting on it. Don't bother staying here, stay off the strip if price is a concern or sleep in your car... I probably will be cleaner.

reviews.title: Enjoyed the Flamingo
reviews.text: Our third trip to Vegas this year and our first time at the Flamingo. We enjoyed the hotel; was just fine for the money. Staff was very courteous and helpful and we had no problems at all. Restaurant was great~~good food and good service. Always love staying mid-Strip and never get tired of the people, music, lights ~~ everything is just fun fun fun ! It was extremely busy and so there were times when it took a bit of time to find slot machines side by side so my husband and myself could sit together. The "Drink Girls" came around often and were courteous! All in All .. great hotel if you don't want to spend a ton of money (as most of us spend little time in the room anyway).

reviews.title: Loved the Flamingo
reviews.text: Having Seen the Flamingo mentioned on a TV program we booked to stay here during our west coast tour of America. We were not disappointed. We were able to check in and out using a machine which was really quick and convenient. Our room although a long walk from reception was large and clean with nice big windows. The location of the Flamingo is a real bonus, right on the strip in the middle of everything. The buffet although extra was huge with lots of choice. Parking was free and easy. Our favourite part of the Flamingo was the pool, which was a nice place to get over the night before, although we were not keen on the animals being kept there as a tourist attraction. That goes for Las Vegas in general though, particularly the lions and tigers in some of the hotels. Anyway I am digressing. We would recommend the Flamingo to anyone visiting Las Vegas and would definitely stay here again.

reviews.title: no longer a great value
reviews.text: We checked in at the airport for a five night stay on October 26th. This is our third stay at Flamingo in the last twelve months. Free upgrades seem to be a thing of the past as this time, they wanted $20 extra per night for a view of the strip.

reviews.title: The Flamingo was great
reviews.text: Never noticed construction crews or noise. Upon entering the room we found an ashtray full of cigarettes, dirty soap in bathroom, dirty glasses & trash in the garbage cans. this was in spite of the clean sheets and otherwise clean-looking room. Maids promptly came up to remedy the situation and apologized the 30 minutes they were cleaning. Our room was smaller than the last two times and the furniture was a bit more 80s than 90s, but the view of caesar's was nice.

reviews.title: Meh...
reviews.text: Noticed the hotel was a bit shabbier overall than in May or last October.

reviews.title: The most comfortable bed of our recent trip to the USA
reviews.text: As always, Java Coast by the pool serves up healthy fresh food and we took advantage of the convenience and location.

We choose to stay at the Flamingo after staying off the Strip at the Gold Coast Casino last year(which was FANTANTIC). For whatever reason my cousin who booked the trip and got an good rate of $70 a night was not made aware of the $100 per night damage deposit. We are not clueless and have paid deposits at other hotels but never way more the the actual room cost or at least paid a flat rate. Luckily we had a very nice clerk (Benjamin)who only charged us a straight $100 for the entire stay. It did kind of left a negative feeling for the rest of the trip, but regardless we moved on.
reviews.title: It was 50/50

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Our room was Deluxe Queen in the north tower. The room itself was clean, average... 3 star. The one problem was the shower. It had the stream of a cheap garden hose and the soap was like chalk. We spent an afternoon at the pool and I do agree with other reviewers that is does have the light scent of the zoo. We ate breakfast everyday at the Tropical Breeze cafe(24hr) the prices and the quality of the food were good. Margaritaville is a definate must. Between the food, drinks, atmosphere and the crazy erupting Volcano it was a good time.
reviews.title: The Flamingo is great for the price!

likes.liked: — The GO rooms are fun as they are different ( high tech).

reviews.title: You can do better for theprice
reviews.text: Overall I would not stay here again, but if you are looking for a decent stay on the strip for not to much $$$ the Flamingo is the best bet. Location is definately the number one reason to stay here.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed at the Flaming for two nights. We stayed in one of their GO rooms with a view of the strip. We have no complaints and will stay there again. We have been to Vegas numerous times and the staff at the Flamingo are by far the friendliest and the most accommodating staff we have incurred to date.
reviews.title: Great Time, Great Location

likes.liked: — It was right in the middle of the strip

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The only complaint we have with the Flamingo is they allow young women to meet their male "escorts" there. On our last night in Vegas, my husband was a little uncomfortable walking by the back bar, where they like to hang out, as they were approaching male customers as they walked by.
reviews.title: Awesome stay

likes.disliked: — Didn't have a view of the strip

reviews.title: Take pause, be advised
reviews.text: Think you reserved a room to meet your specifications. Think again. Rooms are dolled out on a first come first serve basis. Your room preferences are regarded as only that - preferences. And all those reviews about the smells in the pool area. They're true -- it smells like a zoo. Want a clean room? Don't come here: dirty carpets, mould around the shower, feces on the toilet, littered hallways, filthy elevators. Also, bathtub didn't drain and toilet didn't flush properly. Bed bugs? I don't know but I had bites of some sort in the morning. And, how about internet service at $13.00 a day. No kidding! Even at that I couldn't access it due to problems with the hotel's server. After promising to come to fix it, no one ever showed up.

reviews.title: Great hotel
reviews.text: So, take pause and be advised. Enjoy your holiday.

We stayed as a family of nine in four 'Go' rooms at the time a supplement of $25 was applicable but worth every penny. Directly opposite Ceasars Palace and views of 'The Strip' were magnificent. Very quiet, very comfortable and a resort within itself. Sun at this time of the year is only directly on the pool between 10am and 2pm. Be prepared for BIG and at times frenetic and transient. You won't get Ritz style service but centrally located and good value for money. Stay Monday to Thursday for the best deals. ( It wasn't mentioned when booked that the view of the 'Strip' would be extra). So maybe better to book direct.
reviews.title: Perfect stay on the strip

reviews.text: We had a party of 14 adults in 7 rooms (5 GO rooms and 2 Std) for 3 nights. Our check-in went very smooth for Saturday 1pm. A couple rooms ready and the others were no later than 4pm. My fiance' and I along with two other couples were given rooms on the 25th floor. Our room overlooked the Bellagio fountains and was a very clean GO room. We ate at the buffet one morning and had lunch in the cafe one day. Both experiences were fine. The food and service were right what we expected for the price. We held court each evening at the Island Bar in the lobby area near the shops. Perfect small bar that fit our group of Buffet fans to a T. Did I mention that the hotel threw a street party on the north side of the hotel all day Sat 10/20 with Tommy Rocker and the Conched Out Band doing a live 6 hour show. Over the top good promotion! Last but certainly not least I'd like to say that the staff at this hotel were very warm, friendly and helpful. We had a lot of people in our group that are 'picky' when it comes to lodging etc.
reviews.title: Good Stay In A Go Room

reviews.text: I never heard of one single complaint from any oif our 7 couples.
reviews.title: Fair room for a fair price
Great Value
reviews.text: My sister and I stayed at the Flamingo in early May for two nights on our way to the Grand Canyon. The front desk was terrific and extremely accomodating. We had gotten a great AAA rate and on our arrival asked for an upgraded room so we could see the Bellagio fountains. We were on the 21st floor directly across from Caesar's Palace Fountains and the Bellagio to the left. Great full length windows were well worth the little extra for the view both during the day and it was magnificent at night.

The room was nice, clean, and the best part is location, location, location. It's right in the heart of all the more expensive hotels. Easy walking distance to the Bellagio, Caesar's, Venetian, Mirage, Treasure Island, etc. Casino was nice but a little smokey....newer hotels have high ceilings and better circulation.
reviews.title: Run away!
Great value, great location.
reviews.text: Flamingo grounds were very nice. Parking easy. All in all would definitely recommend.
Don't miss the "O" show at the Bellagio. Fantastic!! Need to book ASAP however.
reviews.title: Great hotel

reviews.text: Out of a 6-night stay, we had 3 maintenance problems, no housekeeping the first day we were there, and terrible service when we placed a request. There was blood on the comforter when we arrived, and it took multiple phone calls to get it replaced. It took multiple phone calls to get anything done. Several of the elevators were out of order for all or part of our stay. Seems like maintenance is not a big priority for the Flamingo.
reviews.title: Good value, superb location.

description: From the newly designed GO Rooms to a wealth of dining and entertainment choices, Flamingo proves "fabulous is forever." With classic Las Vegas style and flair, it continues to be one of the Strip’s most-visited resort destinations. Outside, guests enjoy acres of waterfalls, winding pools and lush foliage at the Lagoon Pool and Wildlife Habitat. For adults, the GO Pool is the destination for an afternoon of relaxation. Inside, enjoy performances ranging star siblings Donny & Marie to comedians George Wallace and Vinnie Favorito. Afternoon frivolity is found at Nathan Burton’s Comedy Magic while adult fun is staged nightly at X Burlesque, the Topless Review. Diners can enjoy go tropical at Jimmy Buffett’s Margaritaville or simply go all out at the Paradise Garden Buffet. Flamingo is also the home of the world's first Margaritaville Casino, a Parrothead paradise straight out of a Jimmy Buffett album. For those on the go, the new Flamingo Food Court hosts a variety of eateries from the all-American menu at Johnny Rockets to a taste of the Orient at Pan Asian Express.
